results.title: Romeo and Juliet (Royal Ballet)
results.creator_credit: Colin Nears, Kenneth MacMillan, BBC-TV, National Video Corporation and Royal Opera House Covent Garden
results.brief_description: The Royal Ballet (Great Britain) presents a performance of Romeo and Juliet from the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden. Music: Sergei Prokofiev. Choreography: Kenneth MacMillan. Romeo: Wayne Eagling. Juliet: Alessandra Ferri. Mercutio: Stephen Jefferies. Tybalt: David Drew.

results.title: Peer pressure: nobody tells me what to do
results.brief_description: Gary, an adolescent boy, wishes he was more like the school tough guys. However, a series of events involving shoplifting and breaking and entering help him to realize that he was in the right track to begin with

results.title: Peer pressure: learning to be yourself
results.creator_credit: Renee Ross, Greg Logan and Barr Films
results.brief_description: A fifteen-year-old girl learn to understand how she allows peer pressure to affect her life. Insecure and hoping for acceptance, she acts accordingly to gain approval. Her older brother helps her recognize that she should be paying more attention to her own feelings when makng decissions. Defines and discusses the more subtle types of peer pressure.

results.title: Ocean challengers
results.creator_credit: David Perry, Brian Morris and Soundsense Film Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the epic voyage of the First fleet and contrasts it with the journey of group of adolescents who were prize-winners in an essay competition about the First Fleet. The students sailed from North Queensland to Sydney Harbour as crew members of a schooner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Perry, Brian Morris and Soundsense Film Productions

results.title: Pies
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Cohen, Caroline Leaf and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A bizarre animated tale in which two women on the edge of town argue over whether one of them should be entitled to keep a cow. The argument develops into a planned revenge but the tale has a wry twist to it

results.title: Bicycle stall in Malaysia
results.creator_credit: John Gray, Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: Overviews the role of the bicycle by focusing on a family who earn their living by selling soup from a bycicle stall. The bicycle is also used as a means of transport for people and goods.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Gray, Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia

results.title: Le Jongleur = The Juggler
results.creator_credit: Thomas Vamos, Helene Verrier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A juggler opens his magic box and takes out three balls. The audience marvels at his dexterity until one ball escapes. The mutinous ball assumes magical properties as it draws the juggler into a series of adventures with many levels of meaning: appearance, fantasy and love. The spectator’s age and subjective impressions determine the interpretation of this non-narrated tale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thomas Vamos, Helene Verrier and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Mollusks: the mussels - respiration and digestion
results.brief_description: Shows the systemic biology of mollusks. Illustrates exactly how the structure of the mollusk is related to its functions.

results.title: Crystals: flowers of the mineral kingdom
results.brief_description: Discusses the shape of crystals, depicts frost farming and goes on to show simple applications of crystals. The relationship between crystal properties and uses is illustrated with aluminium.

results.title: Chicago's modern architecture
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: A comprehensive look at Chicago’s modern architecture. Covers the Chicago school, modernism and post-modernism and shows the way in which the post modernists attempt to revive classical architectural features. Includes works by Sullivan, Richardson, Wright, Burnham and Root, Jeny, Van der Rohe, Yamasaki and Elmut Jahn.
